intro: Astragalus pseudocaspius subsp. woronowii, commonly known as the Caspian milkvetch, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, such as steppes and rocky slopes. It has a deep root system that allows it to survive in nutrient-poor soils. This subspecies is of interest in ecological studies due to its adaptability and role in local ecosystems.
